workflow.name: Automatically enrich Salesforce accounts with web crawling, LinkedIn data, GPT
workflow.description:
*Crawl the web, mine LinkedIn, think with GPT, and auto‚Äëenrich Salesforce‚Äîall inside n8n.*

---

## üîß How It Works (High-Level)

1. **Listen** ‚Äì Trigger on new Salesforce Accounts.  
2. **Discover** ‚Äì Crawl the company site (depth-limited) + grab/parse LinkedIn.  
3. **Distill** ‚Äì GPT (JSON mode) returns a clean insight object + HTML summary.  
4. **Enrich** ‚Äì Update the Account record in Salesforce automatically.

---

## üõ† Setup Steps (‚âà15‚Äì25 minutes)

1. **Import** the workflow JSON into n8n.  
2. **Connect Credentials**: Salesforce OAuth2 + OpenAI API key.  
3. **Tune Settings**: Set `maxDepth` (default = 1), confirm the model (e.g., gpt‚Äë4o).  
4. **Test** with a sample Account to verify crawl + update.  
5. **Enable Trigger** and let it run.

---

## üíº Business Impact

- **Zero manual research**: Insights appear in Salesforce instantly.  
- **Consistent data**: Unified JSON schema + confidence rating.  
- **Faster qualification**: Reps see services, size, HQ, etc., without leaving SF.  
- **Scalable & automated**: Works 24/7 on every new Account.  
- **AI-ready outputs**: Raw JSON for automations, HTML for dashboards/Lightning.

---

### üåü Optional Enhancements

- Push insights to Slack/Teams.  
- Auto-create tasks if rating < 60 or data missing.  
- Archive raw HTML to S3 for audits.

nodes.name: Fetch HTML Page
nodes.notes: Makes HTTP request to fetch the content of the current URL.

nodes.name: Init Crawl Params
nodes.notes: Defines the root URL, domain name, and max crawl depth.

nodes.name: Init Globals
nodes.notes: Initializes the pending count in static data for crawl completion tracking.

nodes.name: Extract Body & Links
nodes.notes: Parses HTML content and extracts body text and anchor href links.

nodes.name: Queue & Dedup Links
nodes.notes: Cleans and deduplicates links. Tracks visited URLs. Prepares next crawl queue.

nodes.name: IF Crawl Depth OK?
nodes.notes: Validates whether the current depth is below the maximum depth allowed.

nodes.name: Requeue Link Item
nodes.notes: Removes internal 'type' field and re-enqueues the link for next crawl.

nodes.name: Loop Links (Batches)
nodes.notes: Iterates through the queue of links to be crawled one at a time.

nodes.name: Store Page Data
nodes.notes: Captures the URL, page content, and depth for storage or export.

user.name: Le Nguyen
user.bio: Salesforce Architect with 10+ years of experience in CRM, integrations, and automation. Skilled in Apex, LWC, REST APIs, and full-stack dev (JavaScript, .NET). I build secure, scalable workflows in n8n‚Äîconnecting Salesforce, Stripe, and more. Passionate about lead scoring, data sync, and secure field masking. Certified Application Architect with deep expertise in platform, integration, and data architecture.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
